Section 25A of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to replace "qualified tuition and related expenses" with "higher education expenses" and define it as any expense considered in determining the cost of attendance for the taxpayer, spouse, or dependents eligible for a deduction under section. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to replace "qualified tuition and related expenses" with "higher education expenses" for deductions at eligible educational institutions. Amendments are made to various sections to reflect this change. The amendments made by this section apply to expenses paid after December 31, 2008. SEC. 2 amends section 72(t)(7) of the Internal Revenue Code to define higher education expenses for education furnished. The amendment applies to distributions after December 31, 2008. SEC. 3 addresses qualified scholarships. SEC. 3 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 amends the definition of higher education expenses for qualified scholarships. The term now includes any expense considered in determining a student's cost of attendance at an eligible educational institution. These changes apply to amounts received after December 31, 2008. SEC. 4. INCOME FROM US SAVINGS BONDS. Section 135(c)(2) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to define 'qualified higher education expenses' as expenses within the meaning of section 25A(f). Subsection (c) of section 135 is also amended to update the terminology from "tuition and fees" to "expenses." These amendments apply to expenses paid after December 31, 2008. SEC. 5. DEDUCTION FOR QUALIFIED TUITION AND RELATED EXPENSES. The Internal Revenue Code is amended to replace "qualified tuition and related expenses" with "higher education expenses" in various sections. The term "higher education expenses" is defined and shall be reduced in the same manner as specified in another section. Conforming amendments are made throughout the Code to reflect this change. Section 222 of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to replace "qualified tuition and related expenses" with "higher education expenses". These changes will apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2008. SEC. 6. QUALIFIED TUITION PROGRAMS. Amends section 529(e) of the Internal Revenue Code to define "qualified higher education expenses" for beneficiaries at eligible educational institutions. Also, makes a conforming amendment to section 1400O and specifies that the changes apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2008.
